Posts.Content: May 27, 2012 01:03PM Browneyes48 wrote: Hello Everyone, Had my BMX with TE on the 18th drains came out last Friday, 2 were still draining 75cc, but PS did not want to leave them in as it can be a source of infection, He even started filling the balloons, not alot of pain just feelings of engourgement and I think they are muscle spasms, taking Flexeril and perocet, and IBP which help alot, Still sleeping in the recliner chair this offers more comfort and wearing a tank with built in bra from Walmart ($7) which also helps,  Will find out path report and SN report on Thurs. also the braca Gene results, very nervous, I just hope the tightness in my chest goes away.  Hope everyone else is doing well and good luck to everyone still waiting, It is better than expected.
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: May 3, 2012 04:33PM Browneyes48 wrote: Hello Everyone, Hope all is well with post-op recovery for  Floridamomandwife, Melissa119 & markat & Anke72 & ValFLA, mikismom,  Good Luck tomorrow  - bellamarie I will say my prayers!.  Thanks on the tips on the camie's I will look into it, any other tips would be appreciated.  I will be 2wks away tomorrow, while have been anxiously awaiting the surgery the closer I get the more anxious, I will miss my 7 year old's school play but will be able to go to the dress rehersal the day before, trying to keep a smiling face for the family but when I look at my kids I just want to cry that this has happened, Oh well! life is a box of chocolates (LOL) Take care girls and thanks!
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2012 07:19PM Browneyes48 wrote: Hello Everyone, First time posting, I too am having a BMX on May 18th with sentinal node and recontruction,  but just heard Monday my insurance is reviewing approval which scares me to death, Already had a lumpectomy but CA beyond areas of calcifications. I was in a good place with my decision for BMX  but now they could deny me which  means ???? Everytime I think I am strong with this whole horrible dx, wham another let down, I pray for all of you and your surgeries and everyone out there with a dx of breast CA maybe someday this dx will be a thing of the past, Thanks for your ears! God Bless
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: May 9, 2012 05:13PM Browneyes48 wrote: Glad to hear everyone is recovering well, this gives me such hope! Good luck tomorrow  Clowngirl I will say my prayers. I went to my first support group last night with my Aunt who is a survivor, not sure if I was ready but it was good to meet some other women who had MX and got to see the end result after reconstruction. will be happy if mine come out that good. Everyday until the surgery is full of emotions, Not sure if all this has truely sank in, Seeing my BS tomorrow for last visit before sx and meeting with nurse. Oh well just rambling but thanks for listening, God Bless you all
